content: another sci-fi model this week this was inspired by and is similar to but
definitely not the same as a Space Marines Rhino or predator tank
begin by cutting out four of this piece
from double corrugated cardboard sandwich two of them together with some
glue and then apply corrugation cladding cut a strip of thin cardstock or
chipboard and chop up some small segments then hot glue them to the
bottom of each piece to make the treads notice how they go halfway up the front
and back vertical surfaces now cut two of this piece from double corrugated
cardboard attach them with rectangles of chipboard that are 5 centimeters wide
then hot glue the two sides of the tank
to this central portion offset from the front by about a quarter inch as you see
here and the tops of all three pieces should be flush
we're gonna use it a lot of chipboard
and if this is the first time you've seen this channel chipboard is the
grayish Brown stuff at the back of a notepad but you can buy it elsewhere use
it to accessorize the tank look at the original inspirational source image and
draw ideas from it I attached a door to each side some tread guards at all four
corners a rear access hatch two front access hatches with windows cut out some
random structural shapes on the side two hatches on top toward the front drinking
straw is injected with hot glue to make them solid as we did back in episode 54
I used here as exhaust pipes which are attached to some polystyrene mounting
points all of which are attached with hot glue for the main top mounted weapon
here's a one-inch cube of polystyrene that I tapered along one side and then
hot glue two drinking straws two beads which in turn are attached to the phone
and then the whole thing is attached to the top of the tank use a magnet if you
like
black bomb the entire thing base in blue just as we did back in episode 54 paint
the tread guards and the main cannons with a light gray edge highlight the
entire piece with a harbor blue again as we did in episode 54 for the mech
paint on your metallics I did gun metal
on the top hatches and the exhaust pipes black wash the entire piece just as in
episode 54 put some white dots at the corners of each panel applied with a
toothpick kind of implying rivets solid black dots along the exhaust pipes
applied with a fine brush these are like cooling holes some icon transfers which
I created exactly as described back in episode 9 except that these are only one
sided and I attach them to the tank with plain old glue stick it finally gets
some plain Brown and sponge it along the bottom
yep pretty happy with this one there's
no substitute for the real thing of course the models might be expensive but
they are gorgeous you do get what you pay for but I'd rather spend the $0.50
and two hours that this thing took I am why lock thank you for joining me and
I'll see you next time
